content.description: Sit start matched at the base of the crack, feet at the edge of the small roof (right of the start), trend left through edges in the crack with poor feet below you, match up on the good edge just before the arete, get your feet under you and rock up onto the slab to end the climb.
content.location: On the face of the boulder to the right of the small roof, arguably the clearest line on the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with hands in small crimp slots just under the small roof, with good feet below you, make a big move up to the lip, match it up, traverse a move or two left to the highest point and topout just right of the small dihedral on the good edges on the lip.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, the landing under the small roof is not great/a bit rocky.
content.location: Starting below the small roof in the crack, moving straight up, finishing the same as for Over the Hill.

content.description: Start the same as for Under the Fence, matched at the base of the crack, feet at the edge of the small roof (right of the start), trend left through edges in the crack with poor feet below you, match up on the good edge just before the arete, and continue left around the arete, traversing the lip to topout at the highest point, just before the dihedral on the left side of the roof face.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, the climb traverses around the arete and the fall zone under the roof is not great.
content.location: This climbs starts on the face of the boulder to the right of the small roof, traversing left through the crack, around the arete along the lip.

content.description: Sit start matched in the crack with good feet low in the crack and on the arete, pull on and make a move up to the arete and then span out left to a sloped edge, squeeze a little, get your feet further up in the crack and then bump hands up on both sides until you can reach up to the good holds at the lip, get higher feet, and rock over to finish.
content.location: On the far side of the boulder (if approaching from Super Crack 2 or the Moonwalk boulder), this climb starts around the corner from the small roof and dihedral on the 'front' face.

content.description: Stand start at the crack at ~chest height with good feet below you, move straight up using edges and pressing in the dihedral to reach good holds at the lip, topout right at the peak of the dihedral on good holds.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, the landing is a bit rocky and not even ground.
content.location: On the left side of the small roof face, starting in and going directly up the small dihedral.

content.description: A small boulder at the top of the Hillside cluster. The main feature on the boulder is a small roof on the front face, but there are a few other good problems on this rather short boulder.
